column4: i disagree. If you can overflow a buffer and fill it with shellcode, you could, if the program you've exploited had root, get a rootshell ;-)
compare that to the 1% secure from m$
thats not something a firewall has any effect on though...well, except the phone home part...in which case you block outgoing ports, not incoming ones
if it's a smart firewall it'll filter out the shellcode and thus preventing the overflow ;-)
